function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of access to medical care and basic services in informal developments","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Socio-economic impacts and social consequences of the pandemic","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in tourism activities leading to improved water quality in venice","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in agricultural and industrial activities leading to improved groundwater quality in tuticorin, india","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative impact of warm and sunny weather on compliance with 'stay-home' rules","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Smart city technologies may not be uniformly accessible, leading to inequitable distribution of benefits and access to pandemic response tools.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinformation spread through smart city platforms and technologies may exacerbate the spread of pandemics and hinder control efforts.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Smart city infrastructure may lead to increased surveillance and potential invasion of privacy, which can lead to citizen resistance and civil liberties violations.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on smart solutions may lead to digital divide, excluding people and organizations with limited skills and access to technology from pandemic control measures and recovery efforts.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promoting the use of inclusive smart solutions that raise awareness and create innovative platforms for engagement of all citizens in social activities.","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on smart city initiatives for pandemic response","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for healthcare services in aging communities","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of certain career groups from teleworking may create disparities and inequalities in access to remote work opportunities.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread and transmission of virus in public places","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of crises such as covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to data for evidence-based decision making","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragmented governance and limited cooperation between different sectors and levels of governance","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continued spread of covid-19 in some countries leading to further waves of infections and lockdowns","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for future pandemics to emerge","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to clinical psychotherapists for marginalized populations","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social support for isolated individuals during covid-19","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of mental health strategies in pandemic areas","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective communication leading to increased social fear related to covid-19","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate psychological support leading to negative emotions and psychological distress","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived lack of transparency from health and government authorities concerning the severity of the outbreak.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived difficulties in interpreting quarantine protocols and lack of clear rationale/guidelines.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low resilience to social threats such as pandemics leading to higher risk of developing psychiatric conditions.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Symptoms related to quarantine reported in 28% of parents relative to 6% of those who were not quarantined.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"9% of hospital staff reported higher depressive symptoms 3 years after quarantine.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher depressive symptoms were reported in subjects with higher rates of quarantine.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of alexithymic traits may reduce psychological resilience in some individuals.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative outcomes from the imposition of quarantine-related anger","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological distress due to quarantine and isolation","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 epidemic on mental health","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological impact of quarantine related to covid-19 infection","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of direct strategy to manage psychosocial issues related to covid-19 crisis","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological impact of covid-19 outbreak on mental health","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monitoring environmental and climatic precursors of disease outbreaks","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need to strengthen public health preparedness, including surveillance and monitoring","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monitoring environmental and socioeconomic drivers of disease","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of environmental monitoring in public health surveillance systems","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on external data sources for wnf case data and temperature anomalies may introduce inaccuracies and inconsistencies.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on temperature anomalies and environmental variables may overlook other important risk factors for wnv transmission.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of human and behavioral factors in wnv transmission risk assessment.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of cases with travel history from the analysis","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on geo-referenced environmental and climatic information for spatial modeling","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of climatic, weather, environmental, and health data","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social inequality as a factor in the emergence and transmission cycle of malaria in greece, particularly among migrant workers from endemic countries.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequacy of traditional public health strategies to cope with the public health challenges associated with global environmental change and emergence of vbd in the european union.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of pathogen surveillance in the blood supply","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"}]}
